intro: Eriocaulon gulnarparianum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a slight sheathing at the base. Eriocaulon gulnarparianum plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
